page.title: 12HOLLINGWORTH AND ENVIRONS
page.content: Hollingworth is in the Longdendale Valley. The River Etherow flows from east to west past the side of an old cotton mill called John Walton's. There used to be a lot of cotton mills which were always near water so that they could make steam to work the machines in the mills. The mills are now derelict or being used for small businesses. The older houses were built on either side of the busy main road. Round about are hills and grazing land and pasture land for sheep and cows. There are farms and fields where hay is made for cattle to eat in the winter. There are dry stone walls to separate the fields. There is a big farm called Meadow Bank Farm where they sell milk to the people. A tanker also collects milk from the farm.
